paragraphs.name: fc39
paragraphs.text: It’s a POV shot as we walk down Main Street. Various men cat-call and whistle. We assume that we’re a sexy woman. We pass a construction site, where builders remove their yellow helmets and shout sexual obscenities, objectifying the protagonist. We’re obviously very (conventionally) attractive. Finally, we enter an apartment. We approach a kitchen cupboard and prepare a pair of Pop Tarts. They are soon toasted. As the protagonist raises a tart to their mouth, we approach a mirror and we see, the big reveal, that WE ARE A MAN and, if the budget stretches, Chris Pratt.

paragraphs.name: fc39
paragraphs.text: It’s a POV shot as we walk down Main Street. Various men cat-call and whistle. We assume that we’re a sexy woman. We pass a construction site, where builders remove their yellow helmets and shout sexual obscenities, objectifying the protagonist. We’re obviously very (conventionally) attractive. Finally, we enter an apartment. We approach a kitchen cupboard and prepare a pair of Pop Tarts. They are soon toasted. As the protagonist raises a tart to their mouth, we approach a mirror and we see, the big reveal, that WE ARE A MAN and, if the budget stretches, Chris Pratt.

A feral-looking child leaves a rural infant school. He walks alone, behind large groups of children reading novels. When he arrives home, his mother asks how school was. He doesn’t answer. Instead, he tries to pronounce the phrase ‘final warning’ on a manila envelope. The mother, with a loving look, suggests they go to McDonald’s. They collect food from a drive-through and park up. The boy traces his finger across his cheeseburger wrapper and, hesitantly, says ‘cheeseburger’. His mother puts aside her Diet Coke and hugs him. We fade to the phrase ‘I’m lovin it’. Soft piano music.

a0efdf3474eb.title: All of the ideas cracked me up . Great article :) You Sir are a funny man :P

paragraphs.name: 387d
paragraphs.text: All of the ideas cracked me up . Great article :) You Sir are a funny man :P

paragraphs.name: 6de2
paragraphs.text: Great piece. I recently thought of an ad campaign that ran around 17–18 years ago. Theme: banks as the bearers of Third World liberation. It shows a poor, brown-skinned boy, excitedly running through his village, which appears to be in the Middle East. He runs past a group of children and an aerial shot pans on him yelling excitedly, in a heavy accent, as if it were a religious incantation: “ATM! ATM!”

paragraphs.name: 346a
paragraphs.text: The Revolution will be Branded.

b6d79aa5538f.title: The Pop Tart one is cute, methinks.

paragraphs.name: 6cf0
paragraphs.text: The Pop Tart one is cute, methinks. Although I would suggest someone with a bit more gravitas, like Tom Hardy? :-)

paragraphs.name: a561
paragraphs.text: I love these! The only thing I would change is to remove the line “One of them has a cross tattooed on his forehead” in number 5. I think that defeats the purpose of fighting religious bias because it feels like there’s still bias there, just toward another religion. We all know some Christians are racist skinheads, but not all of them.
